result.execSummary:
The defendant Vernon M. Richardson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
3:15 PM Defendant Vernon M. Richardson in court, in custody.  Attorney Kathryn E Hayes in court for Vernon M. Richardson.  Prosecuting attorney Rick C Spoentgen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  State states joint recommendation.  Atty Hayes agrees.  No VIS or restitution.  Chapter 950 has been complied with.  Guilty Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court finds Defendant guilty.  Court withholds sentence.

Count 2: Dismissed but read in 

Count 1:

3 years Probation, concurrent to 22CF291, must contact P&P by 4 p.m. on 10-18-22

No jail credit

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:

Treatment, counseling, evaluations per agent
$621.00 Restitution with 15% Surcharge To:  (PAID THRU SAUK CO. CLERK OF COURTS), 60 days to pay or set up a payment plan with the Sauk Co. Clerk of Courts

Paperwork handed in court.

Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Atty Hayes stands mute.  Court enters not guilty plea(s) - set for TSC in about 60 days.  Bonds continued.

Arraignment scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
